definition[0]: a very small piece of burning material produced by a fire or by hitting or rubbing two hard objects together
example[1]: The scrape of metal on metal sent up a shower of sparks.
definition[1]: a flash of light caused by electricity passing across a space
example[2]: electric sparks from a broken wire
definition[2]: a small action or event that causes something to happen, especially trouble or violence
example[3]: The judge’s verdict provided the spark for the riots.
example[4]: Interest rate cuts were the spark the market needed.
definition[3]: a quality of intelligence or energy that makes someone successful or fun to be with
example[5]: She was tired, and lacked her usual spark.
example[6]: McKellen’s performance gives the play its spark of life  (=quality of energy).
definition[4]: to be the cause of something, especially trouble or violence
example[7]: The police response sparked outrage in the community.
example[8]: A discarded cigarette sparked a small brush fire.
definition[5]: to produce sparks of fire or electricity
